website_summaries.verdict: Aimed at casual, a.k.a. consumer-level, photographers, the Pandigital Personal Scanner/Converter - 5x7 PanScn04 makes photo scanning easy for up to 5 by 7 inch prints.
pros: Scans photographic prints up to 5 by 7 inches
Includes two plastic sleeves to protect prints and 1GB memory card to scan to

customer_reviews.title: Fast, convenient, but lackluster image quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely much faster and more convenient than scanning with my flatbed scanner. It feeds pictures through very quickly and saves on SD cards, not needing to even turn on a computer. Great to just scan hundreds of pictures, while you're doing something else, like watching TV. However, where it's lacking is the image quality. Pictures look pretty grainy and colors are lost on the computer monitor. I have not tried reprinting pictures yet. The way I see it, I'd rather have a low-quality copy of my photos than nothing at all. I would probably still use something else to scan your favorite photos.
customer_reviews.author: True

customer_reviews.title: What A POS scanner.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two so not sure which we're talking about. First one I sent back cause it wouldn't scan. Second one is sitting on my shelf as a reminder to never buy used again. This should have never been put on the market. Was described as "like new." Yeah, if new means not working.
customer_reviews.author: OldDocKing

customer_reviews.title: Good for casual use but not if you are serious about quality
customer_reviews.text: I needed to scan in several hundred of my fathers photo's and did not want to do it on a flatbed scanner. I purchased this scanner in hopes of making that process quicker. After awhile a line started randomly showing up in the scans. I tried cleaning it per the instructions but it made no difference. Also, sometimes, it was hard to align the photo's feeding into the scanner. The positive is it does make scanning large stacks of photo's easier and faster. Using the supplied photo sleeve made it easy to scan odd size photos or photos with frayed edges.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cantkier

customer_reviews.title: Great little digitizer
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great product to scan in old photos. I have only scanned onto an SD card and then loaded the cards data to the PC. I can scan directly to a PC but I haven't tried that. The picture quality is excellent. You don't need to use the "Sleeves" to enclose the photos for scanning unless the photo is torn. The product comes with all the cleaning supplies you need and is easy to maintain. Follow the users manual and you will get good quality scans. If you don't clean the scanner per users manual you may get streaks on the scan. It scans easily and quickly.
customer_reviews.author: RG0647

customer_reviews.title: This is a good machine. I searched all over for a specific ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good machine. I searched all over for a specific photo scanner and they are hard to find. This has an SD card to that makes it easy to transfer to computer for digital storage which is my main concern. Reads fast. It doesn't have great photo resolution, but I am scanning all the old family photos which are faded and out of focus most of the time and this does a decent job. Then I upload to a photo shop software and make the best of them.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Michel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little scanner that works like a charm and is ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little scanner that works like a charm and is easy to use. You can use a digital memory card or link it directly to your computer to upload photos. It is fast--vastly superior to scanning photos on your printer scanner. Directions suggest putting your photo in a little plastic sleeve before scanning, and if your image does not have clearly defined edges (like a drawing or cartoon without a frame), that is necessary. For most photos, the envelope is not needed. I scanned 50 photos in 20 minutes and only had to re-scan 2.
customer_reviews.author: E-Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Great little picture scanner
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a standard picture scanner than this is it. My wife has hundreds of printed pictures she wanted to capture digitally and neeeded an easy way to scan them. I found this device for a cheap price and it does exactly what she needed it to do. Comes with the removable storage card, but you will need an adapter for that to plug it into a USB port on your PC if you want to load them from the card. Be advised that the company, Pandigital is no longer in business which is why I gave it 4 stars, but this device is priced right and words great.
customer_reviews.author: AGWright

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to quickly scan photos for an anniversary party slideshow I'm making. Over the course of two weeks, I scanned nearly 650 photos for a total of maybe 6 hours. I never had any problems with white lines showing up or the picture being grainy or distorted. I scanned various sizes and paper thicknesses. Overall, I am very impressed and looking forward to using it for more projects.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is an outdated product that will not work with operating systems newer than Vista. I spent two hours trying to get it to work with my Lenova Windows 10 laptop. And since it has been more than thirty days since I bought it (my fault, I bought it and let it set for a few months before opening the box and using it) I cannot returnit.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. W.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product! Instructions so simple
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! Instructions so simple; out of the box, I plugged it, insert SD card (included) and start scanning pictures, so far I got about 400+ pictures without a hitch and still scanning, and very easy to transfer your pictures to your computer, just plugged the scanner USB connector (included) from scanner to your computer... or just pull out the SD Card from scanner and insert it to your SD card slot to your computer, walah. I recommend this product to all my friend.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts useless/ partial refund
customer_reviews.text: Missing part useless adding : after i posted this comment seller contacted me and offered me partial refund, i have receive the partial refund today i bought the save image card and i tested the scanner it scan just fine! i have not tested with the mini usb cord yet but hopefully works. I believe it is worth the price and i appreciate sellers effort to resolve the issue!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Pandigital Photolink One Touch scanner
customer_reviews.text: This was just the product I have been looking for. Working at home I have a normal size flat bed scanner, but on the road I have a greater need for something small and portable. The Photolink One Touch is just what I needed. Easy to use and easy to store, I just drop it in my briefcase and off I go. I do a lot of genealogy work and this device sets up fast and I can scan photos in a matter of seconds. Ease to clean and works well in tight spaces. Using a 2G SD card I can scan and store hundreds of photos at one sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this scanner to assist with my Family Tree project. Grandma gave me a ton of old family photos to scan in and I started out on my flatbed scanner, which took FOREVER! This little guy buzzed through over 350 photos in approximately 4 hours while I watched tv. The memory card that comes with allows you to just scan wherever, without being hooked to a computer. I would (and already have) recommend this scanner to anyone looking to get their family's photos digitized!
customer_reviews.author: Chrryfruitsnack

customer_reviews.title: Ok for basic scans.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a bit better quality scan photo. The colors are washed out compared to the original. Highest resolution is 600 dpi which by todays standards is low. But, its only 54 bucks so what can one expect. I returned the unit. I will be spending a bit more $$$$ on the next scanner.
customer_reviews.author: llacosse

customer_reviews.title: Leaves a streak across photos and I cannot get Customer Support.
customer_reviews.text: Leaves a streak across photos and I cannot get Customer Support.
customer_reviews.author: Sara D.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing given the price
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for a very unfortunate reason. My Daddy passed away this past Easter Sunday, and we wanted to scan as many photos as possible from family & friends. The people complaining about the lines just aren't cleaning it enough. We have scanned literally hundreds and probably over a thousand photos in the past week & 1/2 and have only had to rescan maybe 10 - 15 of them because of the lines. After cleaning the scanner with the included cleaner, sometimes even 2 - 3 times, the lines were gone.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Schalles

customer_reviews.title: scanner
customer_reviews.text: Boy This is great for putting photos on disk and can now get rid of all those picture albums.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Longtin

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great size and it works the way I wanted it to. It does occasionally cause the line across the scanned photo. I however read the reviews and knew this could happen. I just have to clean when this starts to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: This works great for making copies of old family photos
customer_reviews.text: This works great for making copies of old family photos. I love that you can just zip your pics right through it and save them to your computer. I can sit down and scan dozens easily while watching my favorite show. Then I can share them with family easily so that our priceless family photos don't get destroyed or lost for future generations.
customer_reviews.author: Nikole

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm pretty pleased with this overall. It's glitched a few times, but a power cycle has fixed both times. I have concerns about longevity, but for project use, I'm pretty happy so far (the SD card option is fantastic for batch scanning!)... And deceptively small - easy hand-held use.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Good Product.
customer_reviews.text: I used on all my photos then mailed it to family members to do theirs. Easy to use. With the memory card, you don't even have to plug it into the computer to use.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM BARMES

customer_reviews.title: Kathy
customer_reviews.text: I have bee looking for a portable, easy to use scanner for awhile. This product esceeded my expectations. Scanning photos is quick and easy. I can scan over 150 photos in an hour. It is a great way to preserve old photos. The quality of the scanned photos is excellent. I can't wait until they come out with the larger sized scanner. Tip: When you visit your parents/relatives scan in their old photos, download them to snapfish, have them printed at a local store, and pick them up within the hour. You can then label them with names and dates - they can be tagged later which takes a little more time.
customer_reviews.author: K. Oldershaw

customer_reviews.title: Great photo scanning tool
customer_reviews.text: works well with Windows 8. auto crops the photo to perfect size. Instructions on the scanner tell you to insert every photo in the plastic-do so it is easy and gets you the best scan. Just be sure to keep scanning surface clean with tools provided.
customer_reviews.author: NEZ_ADP 555_Man

customer_reviews.title: Fast, easy scanning of snapshots
customer_reviews.text: Nice little scanner for your old paper snapshots. The feed-through design and on-board storage make it easy to handle a large number of photos rapidly. It's a really good solution for those simply wanting to create a digital photo album.
customer_reviews.author: MexicanRadio

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy but a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect solution to scanning with ease. It was a breeze to use and quite quick BUT....after the first 50 scans there were white lines going through EVERY scanned photo Making them unuseable for archiving. Excited for 50...then disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Liptastic

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This product was not as easy to use as I thought it would be. You can't just feed a picture into it, you need to use a tray and there are other requirements. So it was easier not to use it at all!
customer_reviews.author: Le Hook

customer_reviews.title: If my Mom can do it anyone can!
customer_reviews.text: Very simple, put the card in, scan the picture - I bought this as a Christmas gift for my Mom. LIke I said - if she can do it anyone can! It works great - she hasn't scanned hundreds of pictures, just a few here and there that she wants to showcase on Facebook. But I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Traymast

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I got this last night and within a half hour I had scanned over a hundred pictures. It is very fast. The pictures I was doing had been printed 6 years ago and were originally taken with a 3.2 mp camera and they turned out pretty nice, so I am sure that any pictures of better original quality would turn out even better.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great portable scanner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the scanner to save old family photos. I did a lot of research on which scanner to buy and so far I'm extreamly happy with this one. I haven't experienced any "white lines" like some have. I would recommend with older photos, not scanning them at the highest resolution (600 psi) - it just makes the picture grainy. The Pandigital has the option of lowering/increasing the resolution which some photo scanners do not.
customer_reviews.author: Nrconder

customer_reviews.title: Iffieeeeee
customer_reviews.text: It does scan photos well but I constantly have to unplug it to turn on. It turns off by itself and then unplug time. There has to be something better.....gots ta
customer_reviews.author: Rose Orlandini

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little scanner
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little scanner. I've used it for thousands of pictures. It does develop lines on the prints. For old photos just to store not to worrisome. If I needed a really clear copy I might use a higher end scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to transfer old photos to computer
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Little lines do start to appear on photos after about 100. The leaning helped . I could have used more clear sleeves to cover photos as they go through. They do wear out fast.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Nardulli

customer_reviews.title: NO SERVICE!!!
customer_reviews.text: After using the Pandigital Photolink One-Touch PANSCNO4 5-inch Photo Scanner successfully to scan about 50 photos IT ABRUPTLY STOPPED WORKING. When I go to the Pandigital website for support - as indicated in the manual - THERE IS NO SUPPORT SITE THAT I CAN FIND.........OR TELEPHONE CONTACT NUMBER!! I expect a either a replacement unit or help in resolving my problem. DO NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE AT THE PRESENT TIME!
customer_reviews.author: MrPEB

customer_reviews.title: I was happy I could pull it out and scan in pictures ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a couple of years ago and then never used it until Jan 2018 when my mother died. I was happy I could pull it out and scan in pictures of her for her Celebration of life.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie C.

customer_reviews.title: I like this product
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. I used this one for all old hard copy pictures . Very useful. I still use this one from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Salvador Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Great unit,
customer_reviews.text: We have used it several times to transfer still photos. Really dependable and easy to use. Highly recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Popeye

customer_reviews.title: very easy to use and did about 300 photos in about ...
customer_reviews.text: If you want to transfer your photos from photo albums, this is the way to go, very easy to use and did about 300 photos in about 2 hours watching tv, just make sure you use the plastic sleeve to put the photos through the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: NO WARRANTY!!!!  ....and problems
customer_reviews.text: This product is not covered by the 1 year warranty, even though the package contains a warranty card. The website listed on the warranty card is not legitimate. After making only a few scans, a streak has developed on the scanner and all the photos have a streak going through them. After cleaning the product, as shown in the manual, sometimes one or two photos can be scanned without the streak, but it reappears very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Cherryl Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner being skeptical that it would do what I needed it to do.I have had the scanner about a week, and have scanned 2 boxes of old photo's ( 700-800). This scanner meets and exceeds my wildest expectations. I can't believe how easy it is to use, I scanned about 300 pictures while watching South Africa and Mexico play the opening game of the World Cup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great tool
customer_reviews.text: I received the scanner today and tested six 5x7 photos. I noticed in night photos that the black sky had some markings, but not bad at all. I think that most people wouldn't notice it. I scanned at both resolutions and I really couldn't tell the difference on my screen or after printing them. I'll test more, but so far I really like this scanner and the size is incredibly small. I look forward to its getting a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: Runner Girl

customer_reviews.title: It was okay but after using it for about 200 ...
customer_reviews.text: It was okay but after using it for about 200 pictures, a line started showing across the image in my scans.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Keane

customer_reviews.title: Does the job it is intended to do
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Quick scanning and simple to use. I have scanned over 4,000 pictures with great results. Some of the photos I have scanned are from the early 1900s and they have come out great. Yes , I have occasionally gotten the white line other reviews have mentioned, but frequent cleaning and calibration keeps that to a minimum.
customer_reviews.author: S Hattman

customer_reviews.title: So far so good..
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this a few times but it's fast, simple to start and very easy to use. I used a friends first for a while which is why I bought myself one!! Great way to preserve old, fragile photographs.
customer_reviews.author: IndigoMoonArts

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews of photo scanners I was a little bit scared to actually buy one. But this one really works great. I have scanned hundreds of pictures with it so far and it has worked flawlessly. It was such a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sooooooo Disapointed! it crapped out
customer_reviews.text: Sooooooo Disapointed! it crapped out and stopped feeding pictures through after about 12 pictures....i used the plastic sleeve on ALL of them and followed ALLL the directions. So i don't see what the problem was. :/
customer_reviews.author: snoopcluk

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this scanner - scanned over 400 pictures in ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this scanner - scanned over 400 pictures in two weeks and it is working like a champ. I would buy this again and may buy another just to have it on hand!
customer_reviews.author: MHoelzle

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal. For under $40 I'm scanning old photos and I didn't need to spend anytime setting it up, just turn it on, start scanning to the enclosed SD card. Then it's easy to plug that to my iMac and I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: JIR

customer_reviews.title: Great to preserve old pictures digitally
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this to work properly on my laptop with Windows 8 so had to use one with XP. Then it worked great. Quick and smooth. Only thing I disliked was that every scan opened a new window so I had to stop every once in a while to close some windows.
customer_reviews.author: David Guihan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a while...
customer_reviews.text: This scanner worked perfectly when I bought it in February. I scanned photos over a period of 3 months for my son's graduation video and haven't needed to use it again until now. It has been unplugged and stored since May and now device will no longer turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is my second one
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these and like it so much, this is now my second of the same. We use these in our house to scan receipts to do our bookkeeping tasks. Works perfect as it's small & saves to PDF files.
customer_reviews.author: me.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: No bad. It works correctly most of the time and saves time. It is fairly easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa F. Boardman

customer_reviews.title: I have scanned over 4000 pics and it still works like
customer_reviews.text: I've almost worn my out, lol. I have scanned over 4000 pics and it still works like new
customer_reviews.author: Randy Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: This unit has scanned over 4500 photos for me in the last few months. Worked very well and easy to use. There are lines that show up when the scanner is dirty but I suppose that is expected.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Bolante

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: wonderful product. We transferred old photos for a slide show for my mother's 100 birthday party and everyone was amazed. Moving files from the built-in storage to my computer was a bit odd since the numbers of the photos files repeat, but that was a small price to pay for the ease and speed of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Jendrysik

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use scanner
customer_reviews.text: It ia 100% better than the one I originally purchased. Easy to use. Is doing what I needed it to. Quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: like lack of lubrication on rollers that move
customer_reviews.text: Hace un sonido al escanear las fotos, parecido a falta de lubricacion en los rodillos que las mueven , algunas fotos salen con una tenue raya blanca. (a sound when scanning photos, like lack of lubrication on rollers that move, some pictures come out with a thin white stripe )
customer_reviews.author: DAVID MEYEROWITZ

customer_reviews.title: Works well-Good reproduction
customer_reviews.text: Works right out of the box. Good reproduction of scanned photos.Easy to use. Good value for the price. lET'S SEE HOW IT HOLDS UP.
customer_reviews.author: CarmineB

customer_reviews.title: Good quality scanner.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scanner to restore and save all my old pictures in to my computor. The setup and scanning was very easy and I am very happy with this product. Very small and worth the money I paid for it. I will recomend it to my friends, George Pullappallil.
customer_reviews.author: George Pullappallil

customer_reviews.title: Fast & Easy
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget came in a lot more handy than I thought it would. It's just "Plug and Play", You'll be looking for old photos to feed it so you can bring ALL your photos to the Digital age. We actually went through our photos so quickly, I talked my husband into buying us the 8x10 version.
customer_reviews.author: Cheshire64

customer_reviews.title: Requires constant cleaning
customer_reviews.text: It certainly is faster than a flatbed for scanning large numbers of photos, but you must constantly clean the imaging area to avoid lines in the images scans.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Schall-Vess

customer_reviews.title: ... for ways to turn photographs to digital this is perfect for you
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for ways to turn photographs to digital this is perfect for you. I am currently working on turning several photo albums into digital format. The best part is that you can download directly to a a little disk that come with it, so the time to down load is cut in half. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas O. Post

customer_reviews.title: Love this item I scanned over 2
customer_reviews.text: Love this item I scanned over 2,000 photos as I'm moving overseas and as long as you clean every few hundred no white streaks. Very easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Edinlass

customer_reviews.title: great tool to own
customer_reviews.text: I have only just begun to scan all my pictures, but I did around 150 and it took only a few minutes. There was no set up, no long complicated instructions. Worked well. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great well worth the price and it scans pretty fast
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie M. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: The scanner works very well. Somewhat limited by size, but that was expected when I purchased the item. It does a good job of scanning photos very easily without connection to a computer. Can store on chip or directly to a computer.
customer_reviews.author: Pkeeper52

customer_reviews.title: Awesome scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner yesterday and already scanned 80+ pictures in about 10min at 600dpi. The quality of pictures is almost equal to the quality of a HP flat-bed scanner. Not sure how the pic looks when you blow it up to a 8.5x11 or even bigger size. Now I can take a back-up of all my old non-digital pictures quickly before I lose them forever.
customer_reviews.author: Injo

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for those photo scans needed in a pinch. It might be a bit tediious to attempt a large volume of photos with this unit, but it performs well. Quality of the scans is good and does exactly what it's designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: G. Krage

customer_reviews.title: Great for a cheap, simple scanner
customer_reviews.text: Overall it works good and gets the job done. Very simple to use. A little bit of lines in the scans on some pictures, and it "jammed up" every so often, but just took a minute to resolve itself before you could keep scanning.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: This photo scanner has worked exactly as we wanted. We have scanned hundreds of our older photos with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: G. Prance

customer_reviews.title: photo scanner
customer_reviews.text: Just received scanner, it is so easy to use. Love it ! have scanned some very old pictures, put on computer what fun!
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: do the job
customer_reviews.text: clear scanned picture but limited in size for the pictures and the negative films. good but you will miss other options.
customer_reviews.author: Fuad E.

customer_reviews.title: Photo Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner. I can sit at night in front of the TV and just scan my heart out. Great product and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: jjba

customer_reviews.title: and I am very pleased with the results
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I use it for scanning a postcard collection, and I am very pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Pinky

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I've scanned several hundred photos and it has worked great. The plastic sheets that come with it are a pain if there is any dust in the room but when I upgraded my house to "clean room" status it wasn't a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Trent Trimble

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice and Useful
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and easy to use; much faster than flatbed scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick scanning
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to scan a box of old photos, I love it, great for scanning any photos, and it's quick.
customer_reviews.author: SpazRMe

customer_reviews.title: Its' so easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy to scan pictures fast. Great for transferring pictures into digital. I recommend this for anyone who does online scrapbooking!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Goetz

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner
customer_reviews.text: This is a small and compact scanner what is very effective for scanning those old photos and preserving those memories.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: The Pandigital Photolink One-Touch is easy to use. Makes old pictures very clear. After about 700 scans noticed a line across one side. Needs to be cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Cjudson

customer_reviews.title: Great, heavy duty photo scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to scan practically all my photo collection from the 1970's to early 2000's (when I went digital): 7,000 photos in all! This machine did the job amazingly well. Reccommended.
customer_reviews.author: S. Munroe

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all, saved me a lot of time and easy to use. Works with ease. Great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Elvan Chagnard Jr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have used this to help my in-laws digitize their old photos when I go visit them in Boston. It is fast and convenient to pack in backpack to take on plane. Works fast. Don't need computer to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Barker

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This item was exactly as it stated. Pulled right from box and started scanning pictures. Very easy to use and highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: shellgal

customer_reviews.title: Looking for suggestions
customer_reviews.text: Seems to only work with regular sd cards. If they say sdhc, can't get it to work. Curios if anyone else has this problem or have any suggestions. Regular sd cards are getting hard to find
customer_reviews.author: Lori G.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is very easy to use. The pictures are fed into the scanner with ease and the scan is done quickly. The upload to a computer via a USB cable is troublefree.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Corbett

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Yes sometimes the white lines do show up, but if you clean every 50-75 scans, they go away. I have been able to go thru hundreds of photos in a couple hours. So its everything I was looking for. I would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Feldheim

customer_reviews.title: Photo Scanner
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent way of copying old photos & saving them for family to show in the future. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: RosePetal

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with scanner
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the scanner. It delivered on all promises. If it would copy 8X10 photos, I would be even more pleased. I have scanned almost 1000 pictures and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for the memories. Scanning could not be easier. We now have our family's history saved forever. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Berry

customer_reviews.title: SUPER EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Simple and easy to use. Connects to computor via USB port. Uploads pictures easily. Would recomend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Sherman

customer_reviews.title: worked fine. I returned it though because the software was ...
customer_reviews.text: worked fine. I returned it though because the software was the same as my Canon printer. I don't really like the software. It doesn't seem very intuitive to me. When I returned this I had to pay for shipping ( no big deal), In addition, however, I had to pay a 20% restocking charge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: All of the items that were said to be included were not. The only things that were included in this were the scanner and the power cord. No memory card. No cleaning strip. No manual. No photo holder.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great photo scan!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. The scanner is fast,quality of pictures came quite good. I am very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Pascale  Mercier

customer_reviews.title: Does a pretty good job
customer_reviews.text: I like the size. I like that it doesn't have to be connected to a computer when you're scanning. Some pics have a black line around the edge, I think because they're an odd size. I haven't quite figured out how to get rid of those yet. But overall, il Ike it. It does what I bought it for. I want to start scanning family photos. With this little scanner I can sit on the couch and do it while I'm watching a movie or easily take it over to my mom's house and scan some of her pics.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: family albums
customer_reviews.text: If you have a large number of family albums and want a fast way to store them electronicaly this is product for you
customer_reviews.author: samuel e zattiero

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try but no dice
customer_reviews.text: I soooo wish this worked. It scans photos quickly and easily. Unfortunately, the scanned photos have faint vertical lines. I tried with and without the sleeve. The sleeve is a dust magnet btw, so the scanned photos look even worse. I also tried going through the cleaning and calibration process to no avail. I'm sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Fulton

customer_reviews.title: Small and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm....have scanned over 500 pictures so far and not ONE issue!
customer_reviews.author: Jerseymom

customer_reviews.title: Did not work ... waste of time
customer_reviews.text: I scanned 200 photos but when I then went to look at the results saved on the SD card it was empty. Nothing. Nada. No files. I tried another SD card. Nothing was saved. Hours of waste. Item is going back as defective.
customer_reviews.author: WZ

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS BEFORE YOU BUY
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE.... I WOULD NEVER EVER EVER BUY THIS PRODUCT AGAIN. I AM SO FRUSTRATED WITH THIS PIECE OF JUNK. I have scoured the internet trying to find drivers for this scanner and not only can I NOT find drivers... I cannot even find a manufacturers site... they are GONE... not in business... no phone number to call... nothing... horrible that they can even sell something like this ....
customer_reviews.author: Shelle Ann

customer_reviews.title: Not New!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner was listed as new. It was not, the inner box had 3 different types of tape sealing the contents. The scanner would not power up. I contacted DiscountsJungle to have the unit replaced, they insisted on having the unit returned before issuing another unit, which would have added and additional 2 to 3 weeks to my total process time. Not exceptable. The main problem was that the unit was listed as NEW and it clearly was not!!!!
customer_reviews.author: William King

product_meta.title: Pandigital Photolink One-Touch PANSCN04 5-Inch x 7-Inch Photo Scanner (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: Featuring one touch scanning, and requiring no PC, the Personal Photo Scanner/converter from Pandigital makes it easy to enjoy digital copies of all your favorite printed photos, up to 5x7. Designed for ease of use, scanned images are saved directly to SD card for quick and simple transfer to your digital photo frame or PC. Images are scanned as 600dpi full color JPEGs for incredible clarity and quality. Includes 512MB memory card.
feature_bullets: Scan directly to SD card and comes with five in one reader that reads SD/MS/MSPRO/MMC/XD
Simple transfer to your digital photo frame or PC

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars154 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
